questions.questionText: Which of the following is false statement in python
questions.explanation: The built-in int() type constructor converts string and floating value to integer.

questions.questionText: Pylab is a package that combine _______,________&______ into a single namespace.
questions.explanation: pylab package in python combines numpy, scipy & matplotlib into a single namespace.
2**3 gives 2*2*2 i.e. 8, then 2*8 gives 16, since order of precedence is ** then*. ** implies ‘‘ raise to power’’.

questions.questionText: What is output of following code l = [1,2,6,5,7,8] l.insert(9)
questions.explanation: listname.insert(x,y) method is used to insert a item at certain position in a list. x defines position at which the element will be added and y defines the element to be added in the list. And insert function takes exactly two arguments else it results in type error.

questions.questionText: What is the output of the following code? eval(''1 + 3 * 2'')
questions.explanation: Eval is a method used to evaluate the values entered in the braces.

options.text: Func1 and Func2 are tail recursions
Neither Func2 nor Func1 is tail recursion

questions.explanation: A function call is said to be tail recursive if there is nothing to do after the function returns except return its value.

questions.questionText: Which among them is incorrect for set s={100,101,102,103}
questions.explanation: There is no indexing in Sets.
